decision_conditions: The proposed amendment would result insufficient private amenity space contrary to the Policy 7D of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and material impact on the design and external appearance, the proposed amendments therefore cannot be treated as a non-material amendment to planning permission Ref. Planning 182111FUL dated 26/06/2019 in accordance with Section 96a of the Town and Country Planning Act (1990) and the Ealing Protocol for Non-Material Amendments Following a Grant of Planning Permission (2011)
description: Application for a Non-Material Amendment in (S96a) seeking to allow remodel of existing rear plot gardens to provide open communal garden area, with relocation of refuse storage and provision of new cycle store in rear garden, removing integral store to building and separate cycle stores in relation to planning permission reference 182111FUL dated 26/06/2019 for 'Redevelopment to provide a three storey (plus basement level) residential building comprising nine residential units (2 x 1 bed, 6 x 2 bed and 1 x 3 bed) (following demolition of existing residential building) '
